item.title: User has left webchat: use Near Me Messaging to push a message to them!
item.description: On the Christmas morning of 2022, I woke up to a few messages left from a user named Henry. By the time I got to the messages, Henry had already left. All I got was the messages he sent through webchat, and his name.

item.title: Ultimate Guide to Enabling Chat on Google Maps to Connect With Customers
item.description: Google Maps Chat is a great way for businesses to connect with customers. There are different ways to enable Google Maps Chat, a manual one with Google Business Profile, an automatic one with Google Business Messages, and one that takes the best of both worlds with Near Me Messaging. This blog will walk you through how to enable Google Maps Chat with these three different methods.

item.title: Launch Your Virtual Agent on Google Maps With Near Me Messaging
item.description: We have previously introduced you to Near Me Messaging and its benefits. Near Me Messaging implements a Google Business Messages virtual agent, available straight from the chat button on a business’ Google Maps profile. Near Me Messaging’s virtual agent is powered by state-of-the-art natural language understanding that delivers human-like responses. What sets Near Me Messaging apart from similar services is the 5 minute set-up time, self-serve customization, and built-in live chat support.

item.title: Near Me Messaging Complements Google Business Messages
item.description: In one of our previous blogs, we walked you through the benefits and limitations of Google Business Messages. There are two main limitations with common implementations of Google Business Messages. The first limitation is that it takes a lot of money and time to pay a professional consulting agency to create a customized virtual agent for your business from the ground up. The second limitation is that business owners are not able to talk directly to customers unless the consulting agency provides a live-chat feature as part of their implementation.
